summary: This bill, the Agriculture Skills Preparation for Industry Recruitment Efforts Act (ASPIRE Act), amends the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 to authorize grants for eligible institutions to develop and carry out agriculture workforce training programs. These programs aim to promote the growth, competitiveness, and worker retention in the agriculture industry. Eligible institutions include various colleges and schools offering agricultural programs. Grants will be awarded by the Secretary of Agriculture, with a portion of the funds designated for recruitment and faculty training.
